Package it.polimi.ingsw.controller

Class InPauseState

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.controller.ControllerState
it.polimi.ingsw.controller.InPauseState
public class InPauseState extends ControllerState
Class used to represent the paused game state.
See Also:

    • InPauseState

      public InPauseState(GameController controller)
      Class constructor. Sets the game's controller to given value. Starts a timer at the which the GameState is set to RESET_NEEDED
      Parameters:

    • sendPrivateMessage

      public void sendPrivateMessage(String receiver, String sender, String content)
      This method is used to stream a message privately. Only the specified receiver will be able to read the message. It builds a new object message at each call, setting the nicknames of the receiving Players and its message type to PRIVATE.
      Specified by:
      sendPrivateMessage in class ControllerState
      Parameters:
      receiver - the Player receiving the message.
      sender - the Player sending the message.
      content - the text of the message being sent.
      See Also:
      • Player
      • Player.getNickname()
      • Message.messageType()

    • sendBroadcastMessage

      public void sendBroadcastMessage(String sender, String content)
      This method is used to stream a message in broadcast mode. All the players will be able to read the message. It builds a new object message at each call, setting the nickname of the sending Player and its message type to BROADCAST.
      Specified by:
      sendBroadcastMessage in class ControllerState
      Parameters:
      sender - the Player sending the message.
      content - the text of the message being sent.
      See Also:
      • Player
      • Player.getNickname()
      • Message.messageType()

    • startGame

      public void startGame(int numberOfCommonGoalCards)
      The method starts verifying if the Game creation has occurred properly, confronting the number of active players registered during the previous phase with that stored in the Model. Then, it proceeds to adjust the Board and to draw a list of Tiles. Finally, it initializes the ScoreTile list for each active Player, (necessary in order to replace them later if a player complete a CommonGoal). Does nothing since the game is in pause state.
      Specified by:
      startGame in class ControllerState
      Parameters:
      numberOfCommonGoalCards - number of common goal card from which extract the common goal used during the game
      See Also:
      • Game
      • Player
      • ScoreTile
      • CommonGoal
      • Game.getNumberOfPlayersToStartGame()
      • Game.getPlayers()
      • Board.setPattern(JsonBoardPattern)
      • Board.numberOfTilesToRefill()
